ExperimentTitle:
Experiment No. 23 - SMAW T-joint

AIM - To make T-Joint on MS Plate
Steps:
Step 1

Grab the steel ruler from the tool table & measure both the job plates wrt. 150 x 100 x 10mm.

Step 2

Grab the scriber & steel ruler & mark the extra parts on the job plates.

Step 3

Grab the Center Punch & Hammer & make impressions points on the line.

Step 4

Grab both the jobs & fix them one by one on the mechanical vise & cut them with the hacksaw. File both the rough edges with a flat file..

Step 5

Place one job plate on the welding table in horizontal position. Do the scriber marking for the vertical position plate & place the plate in the designated spot. Check whether the angle between them is a right angle with the try square.

Step 7

Attach a 3.15mm electrode to the welding machine & do the tack welding. Check whether the angles between the plates is a right angle with a try square..

Step 8

Place the plates in the upright position & set the current at 110A

Step 9

Set the current at 130A & do the root welding. Clean up the slag with chipping hammer & wire brush

Step 10

Attach the 4.0mm electrode & set the current at 170A. After that, do the cover run welding. Clean up the slag with chipping hammer & wire brush
